treadmill questions

Options
  • Mark as New
  • Bookmark
  • Subscribe to Direct Replies to This Post
  • Subscribe to RSS Feed
  • Highlight
  • Print
  • Email to a Friend
  • Report Inappropriate Content

‎11-04-2014 01:09 PM

I am going to ask for a treadmill for my Christmas present and I was wondering what kind you have and what you like about it.  I would like to keep it around $500 hopefully a sale price.  Today it is rainy and I really don't want to walk in the rain.  Thanks for your input

 

Patti


diet and exercise is my new lifestyle. I will do everything possible to lose weight and get my number down so I can control this disease. I WILL DO IT!!
I am so glad I found this community .

TYPE 2
A1C - 2/13 7.1
stupid me ignored my disease for 20 months and then wondered why I didn't feel good.
BS 154

A1C - 10/14 11.6 (YIKES)
Wake up call, time to get this under control
Triglycerides 410
BS 286

A1C - 12/14 8.6 BETTER
Triglycerides 169 almost normal (50-150)
BS 200

A1C - 3/15 5.6 woohoo I did it
Triglycerides 178 up a little
BS 114

A1C- 6/15 6.1 went up cause I wasn't as strict on my exercising I believe Go back in 6 months so I have time to exercise more lose another 10 pounds and get my numbers back in the 5's

Metformin 500MG 2 x a day Dr took me off this 9/22/15

Atorvastatin 20MG once a day stopped 8/15

Lisinopril 5 MG once a day started 12/514 stopped 8/15


9/22/15 off all medicine only Diet and Exercise


217 10/14
207 12/14
196.5 1/15 I am finally in onederland yeah!!
193.5 2/15
190.0 03/15
185.5 04/15
184.5 07/15

‎11-04-2014 01:41 PM

you may ask for a late Christmas present. If memory serves me correctly around New Years lots of exercise/diet stuff goes on sale as people do their New Years resolutions.  You might get a lot more for your money (os someone's money) by getting that present a week later



You go to school to learn, not for a report card.
You use your meter to learn, not for a report card

Type 1 (LADA).. Novolog/Levemir

Adult onset T1

‎11-04-2014 03:31 PM

Lots of people buy exercise machines and don't use them, then sell them cheap after using them as a clothes rack for several years, so check out Craigslist in your area, you might be able to get a really good one a lot cheaper.

 

 

 

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Type 2 Diabetes diagnosed Feb 2014
Metformin 1000mg twice daily, Victoza, Gabapentin
Cinnamon, Chromium, Fish Oil, Alpha Lipoic acid, Biotin, B12 supplements

I've lost 175lbs since diagnosis, and my most recent a1c was 5.2

‎11-04-2014 04:35 PM - edited ‎11-04-2014 04:37 PM

I don't have treadmill – I use an upright exercise bike – but one thing that I did when I was researching what kind of bike I wanted, was to look on Amazon at the reviews of different ones. That gave me an idea of what people think are important features, and what they like or don't like.
DT2 diagnosed 3/23/2014
Diet & exercise only
A1c @ diag - 04/24/2014 - 9.7
A1c - latest - 10/09/2015 - 5.5
Metformin 1000mg stopped 1/15/15

Re: treadmill questions

‎11-04-2014 05:06 PM

Do you have any kind of back problems/injuries?  A treadmill can exaserbate a back  back if you have certain lower back injuries.  It seems fine at first but just the little jaring from the artificial walking on a treadmill can be painful.  It does not effect everyone that way but we bought a fancy one and I was so upset I could not use it.  I am getting an airdyne bike that has handlebars that you move with your arms so you get a good workout.

 

If you love treadmills that February is the month to buy one. Some people who got them for Christmas are sick of them or not what they expected and want to sell.  Great prices that time of year.

 

I love the varied work out machines at the YMCA or Curves. So want to bring them all home!

 

Xanthra
Type 2
1500 mg Metformin,
Low carb, exercise
600 mg r-ALA with biotin

‎11-04-2014 08:55 PM

Many gyms offer a free trial period. If there is one in your area that does that, another option would be to try their equipment to find out what you like. 

 

You could also try different types of equipment, too, like the stationery bike or eliptical. 

 

You may also want to think about getting some hand weights and/or kettelbells to be able to do resistance training at home. 

 

Report Inappropriate Content

‎11-04-2014 09:47 PM

SanFranDeb wrote:

Many gyms offer a free trial period. If there is one in your area that does that, another option would be to try their equipment to find out what you like. 

 

You could also try different types of equipment, too, like the stationery bike or eliptical. 

 

You may also want to think about getting some hand weights and/or kettelbells to be able to do resistance training at home. 

 

This is a good idea, because you don't know what kind of machine you will really like to use. 

 

A hula hoop is also a fun thing to try...you'd be amazed how much it can tone up your abdomen.

‎11-05-2014 09:15 AM

JBeau wrote:
SanFranDeb wrote:

Many gyms offer a free trial period. If there is one in your area that does that, another option would be to try their equipment to find out what you like. 

 

You could also try different types of equipment, too, like the stationery bike or eliptical. 

 

You may also want to think about getting some hand weights and/or kettelbells to be able to do resistance training at home. 

 

This is a good idea, because you don't know what kind of machine you will really like to use. 

 

A hula hoop is also a fun thing to try...you'd be amazed how much it can tone up your abdomen.

I don't think I've tried a hula hoop since I was about 8. I've never been able to get it to swing. 

 

I can see how it would tone your abdomen, and even most of your core muscles. I can't help but think if I couldn't do it when I was a kid I probably can't do it now... It'd be way more fun than a lot lot of core training exercises, though

‎11-05-2014 05:02 PM

SanFranDeb wrote:
JBeau wrote:
SanFranDeb wrote:

Many gyms offer a free trial period. If there is one in your area that does that, another option would be to try their equipment to find out what you like. 

 

You could also try different types of equipment, too, like the stationery bike or eliptical. 

 

You may also want to think about getting some hand weights and/or kettelbells to be able to do resistance training at home. 

 

This is a good idea, because you don't know what kind of machine you will really like to use. 

 

A hula hoop is also a fun thing to try...you'd be amazed how much it can tone up your abdomen.

I don't think I've tried a hula hoop since I was about 8. I've never been able to get it to swing. 

 

I can see how it would tone your abdomen, and even most of your core muscles. I can't help but think if I couldn't do it when I was a kid I probably can't do it now... It'd be way more fun than a lot lot of core training exercises, though

It took me a while to master it.  The most important thing is to have a big enough hoop.  I made my own hoop from this tutorial: http://www.jasonunbound.com/hoops.html  At first I could only keep the hoop going about 30 seconds at the most.  Now I can go about 45 minutes, but I usually switch directions every so often so that both sides get an even workout.  My kids and I hula hoop together in the driveway every night. 

 

The first couple of times you use the hoop, you end up really sore.  I have too much padding to see bruises on my hips, but my daughter got bruises from her hoop at first, even though her hoop is one of the padded fitness ones from the store.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Type 2 Diabetes diagnosed Feb 2014
Metformin 1000mg twice daily, Victoza, Gabapentin
Cinnamon, Chromium, Fish Oil, Alpha Lipoic acid, Biotin, B12 supplements

I've lost 175lbs since diagnosis, and my most recent a1c was 5.2
